statement.p: What is the area of this floor in square feet?

solution.p: This floor area consists of a rectangular area (on the left) and a triangular area (on the right). First measurements should all be converted to the same unit.
Top edge: \displaystyle{13}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{7}\ \text{ in}={163}\ \text{ in}
Left edge: \displaystyle{6}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{7}\ \text{ in}={79}\ \text{ in}
Bottom edge: \displaystyle{9}\ \text{ ft}\cdot\frac{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}+{8}\ \text{ in}={116}\ \text{ in}
We do not need the length of the right edge (angled).
The area of the rectangle is \displaystyle{\left({79}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({116}\ \text{ in}\right)}={9164}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

The triangles top edge has length \displaystyle{\left({163}\ \text{ in}\right)}-{\left({116}\ \text{ in}\right)}={47}\ \text{ in}. The left edge is 79 in. Thus the area of the triangle is \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{\left({79}\ \text{ in}\right)}{\left({47}\ \text{ in}\right)}={1856.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}.

Thus the total area is \displaystyle{9164}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}+{1856.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}={11020.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}. Converting this to square feet it becomes \displaystyle{11020.5}\ \text{ in}^{{2}}\cdot{\left(\frac{{{1}\ \text{ ft}}}{{{12}\ \text{ in}}}\right)}^{{2}}=\frac{{11020.5}}{{144}}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}={76.53125}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}\approx{77}\ \text{ ft}^{{2}}.
